byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Riyadh, and Scott Shane from Washington.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and SCOTT SHANE

abstract: Prison deposition by former Al Qaeda operative Zacarias Moussaoui contends that prominent Saudi Arabian figures were involved in financing terrorist group in years leading up to September 11, 2001, attacks; accusation, which Saudi Arabia's government has denied, draws attention to some experts' belief that Saudi involvement in 9/11 attacks should be examined.
lead_paragraph: American officials have praised the Saudi government for cracking down on terrorism, but suspicions of a past, tacit alliance with Al Qaeda burst into the open again this week.

headline.main: Pre-9/11 Ties Haunt Saudis as New Accusations Surface
headline.print_headline: Pre-9/11 Ties Haunt Saudis as More Accusations Surface

snippet: American officials have praised the Saudi government for cracking down on terrorism, but suspicions of a past, tacit alliance with Al Qaeda burst into the open again this week.
